title: Tri County students go back in time with dance competition
title_page: Tri County students go back in time with dance competition
maintext:
Tri County Elementary students went back in time on Wednesday at the school’s first ever “Dance Off” competition.
Classes dressed up from different eras and performed songs from their respective decades in the school’s auditorium.
Preschoolers and kindergarten students donned white T-shirts and poodle skirts to perform 1957′s “Great Balls of Fire,” while first- and second-graders embraced all things tie-dye to perform 1963′s “Twist and Shout.”
Apparently disco never died as third- and fourth-graders performed “Stayin’ Alive” in perfect 70s fashion, while fifth- and sixth-graders recalled the 80s with their performance of “Eye of the Tiger.”
Ultimately, third/fourth grade took home first place. The first ever “Dance Off” also featured individuals performances from students. Harley Dike and Ashton Schwisow placed second with their dance to “A Thousand Years.” Avery Schultis was first place, performing to “I’m Still Standing.”
